channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: How did Ukraine transform from a rigid Soviet-style military to a Westernized force? Years of NATO classes, drills and exercises. https://t.co/FJy0eeC663
The last Ukrainian troops holding out in besieged Mariupol rejected Moscow’s ultimatum on Sunday that they surrender or face destruction by Russian forces https://t.co/slMpy6E7kG

Russia called on the last Ukrainian troops fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms on Sunday and observe an hourslong cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed https://t.co/alf9tXNLLY
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/Lvw1NQyNsS

Elon Musk, a self-described “free speech absolutist,” said in an interview last week that Twitter is the “de facto town square,” and that “it’s very important for there to be an inclusive arena for free speech.” Here's what else he has planned: https://t.co/xR2RYFTHo6
“The light is killing me—it’s my main enemy here.” Spending weeks with thousands of strangers under 24/7 fluorescent lights: this is life in a Shanghai mass quarantine center. https://t.co/vAXAeEFSWC
Russia’s expanding military deployments in and around eastern Ukraine in recent days are setting the stage for a new phase of Moscow’s offensive https://t.co/RqXkavRDWI

“Yes, I called it genocide,” President Biden said shortly after his speech last week. “It has become clearer and clearer that Putin is just trying to wipe out the idea of even being, being able to be Ukrainian.” https://t.co/QW07K3DGBe

Russia called on the last Ukrainian troops fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms on Sunday and observe an hourslong cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed https://t.co/DbDqejEXHK
Mariupol has been besieged by Russian troops and pro-Russia separatists for more than a month and has seen some of the fiercest urban warfare in the conflict in Ukraine. https://t.co/oK6cWa8vll
Fund manager, startup founder and blogger Eva Shang is cracking the private debt market. The $400 million she raised in six months says Wall Street is taking notice. https://t.co/35Th6NSucB

As Stephen Colbert was hatching his CBS program, he said he consciously conceived it to be a show about love, but “of course, you can’t say that out loud, because it sounds a little pretentious” https://t.co/eW5GINlj1t
This Easter, connect to Ukraine via pysanky, the country’s highly symbolic eggs, decorated in complex patterns using a centuries-old dye technique https://t.co/3oWswDRr5Q
Pope Francis in his annual Easter address called for peace in Ukraine, warning that the conflict could lead to nuclear war https://t.co/PsFqieesGF
Russia called on the last Ukrainian troops fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms and observe a cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed https://t.co/LnrKDORfsy
Mariupol has been besieged by Russian troops and pro-Russia separatists for more than a month and has seen some of the fiercest urban warfare in the conflict in Ukraine. https://t.co/jyDl8rj9sV

The United Nations’ human-rights agency said that it recorded at least 1,982 civilian deaths in Ukraine since Russia invaded the country, but warned that actual figures could be much higher https://t.co/TFLTB2AeZh

Russia banned British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and other top U.K. officials from entering the country, citing London’s efforts to isolate Moscow over its invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/Dh5AGLvvTB
From @WSJopinion: Inflation in March was the highest in 40 years, and the year-long inflation spike was well underway before Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine https://t.co/81zEJgwPql
Cancún and the Riviera Maya, Mexico’s top tourism spots, are fighting a wave of violent crime. The problem is demand for drugs by tourists. https://t.co/7rWGMDgglY
From @WSJopinion: The press won’t claw back its credibility until it admits why it buried the story, writes Holman Jenkins https://t.co/CC9P4KmZcp

Two century-old churches sit next to each other in a small community outside of Pittsburgh: one Ukrainian Orthodox, one Russian Orthodox. The two pastors have always been friendly, and now they’re trying to defuse tensions related to the war in Ukraine. https://t.co/MnBgIDqgMo
Mariupol has been besieged by Russian troops and pro-Russia separatists for more than a month. The fighting has leveled much of the city. https://t.co/OZQvWvsmWI
“The damage has been done.” Some Shanghai residents say China's strict lockdown has created economic and psychological scars that will endure. https://t.co/a16B9NrJDq
Russian officials said that another of its generals was killed in combat in Ukraine https://t.co/OV5rVI5I61

On Friday, Ukrainian Jews across the country, as well as those now living as refugees in Europe, celebrated Passover with supplies of kosher food and online services provided by American charities https://t.co/k4QcAGTOBI
Politicians threaten to strip Disney of its Mickey Mouse copyright and the special tax status for Walt Disney World, as parents protest in Orlando, Fla. https://t.co/YyRYcPZ80y
Twitter founder Jack Dorsey’s first tweet was converted to a nonfungible token last year and sold for $2.9 million. Now, it may be resold for less than $14,000. https://t.co/PDytyQOqLi
Heard on the Street: Container shipping rates have started sinking. This might only be the beginning of their descent. https://t.co/akMuoQoW6p
McDonald’s suspended its operations in Russia over the war in Ukraine, but some restaurants owned by franchisees still remain open #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/TBxFACiylB https://t.co/k0gtZPhNgv
From @WSJopinion: On Palm Sunday, Robert E. Lee surrendered to Ulysses S. Grant. Lincoln was dead by Easter, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/dQhfzpsu4B
Politicians threaten to strip Disney of its Mickey Mouse copyright and the special tax status for Walt Disney World, as parents protest in Orlando, Fla. https://t.co/tS9XopJZva
TikTok brain is real, researchers say, and it’s affecting kids’ brain development. "We’ve made kids live in a candy store." https://t.co/AKe3ynUjXV
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/cvqJe4JAZs
The Biden administration is resuming oil leases on federal land, in a policy turnaround https://t.co/kK7D5LfWWF
A Ukrainian city that is shelled by Russia nearly every night stands in the way of Moscow’s plans to control Ukraine’s Black Sea rim https://t.co/ePvpEdU6TS
Is globalization ending in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine? No. It’s evolving. https://t.co/QHt08nibS6
JPMorgan’s new Manhattan headquarters will use a hydroelectric power source, making it the tallest and largest New York building to go all electric https://t.co/0KEfZ9Qjio
About 30,000 people are returning to Ukraine each day, according to a U.N. agency, many of them women, children and older people. https://t.co/iFQNR8AR8n

Six U.S. lawmakers met with Taiwan’s leader on Friday in a show of support for the island democracy, in a surprise trip that signals more tension between Washington and Beijing https://t.co/5bnOHdogt5
The Russian missile cruiser Moskva, which was over 600 feet long and more than 12,000 tons, was the biggest warship by tonnage to sink during conflict since World War II https://t.co/avYDWNKXwT
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/AnAvYi07sw https://t.co/9KQA94YNZK

Which is better: A four-day workweek or five? A proposal in the California Legislature would define the workweek as 32 hours for private-sector companies with more than 500 employees https://t.co/29rG6pJFgA
Employers are trying everything to lure work-from-home employees back to the office. It’s not working. Columnist @JasonGay offers a suggestion: doughnuts. https://t.co/HlteRMOVgj

From @WSJopinion: The war in Ukraine is set to enter a bloody new phase as Vladimir Putin prepares an offensive in the east. The question is whether President Biden will summon the mettle to make sure America’s friends win. https://t.co/r4Ni3nRwv0
The average rate on 30-year mortgages hit 5% for the first time since 2011 https://t.co/mtSGwBcwrg
The world’s richest man should be able to buy anything he wants. But can Elon Musk buy Twitter? https://t.co/EbhrD9nXR2

From the dot-com boom to drilling tunnels, Elon Musk’s long list of business ventures have all built to his $43 billion offer to buy Twitter. Take a look back at his past investments. https://t.co/AWzrYRWGw4

President Biden will nominate Michael Barr as the Federal Reserve’s top banking regulator. His first pick withdrew amid opposition from Republicans and a key Democratic senator. https://t.co/QpIikD2lXi
The U.S. confirmed that the Moskva, the flagship of Russia’s Black Sea fleet, was struck and sunk by a pair of Ukrainian missiles https://t.co/w12IrqDBxe
